definition:
The simplest form of the equation presenting a (without the ) in a
rectangular coordinate system is got when the coordinate axes coincide
with the axes of the hyperbola, and it has the form $$\begin{aligned}
\frac{x^2}{a^2}-\frac{y^2}{b^2} = 1.\end{aligned}$$ Here, $a\, (>0)$ is
the and $b\, (>0)$ the of the hyperbola.

The equation $$\begin{aligned}
\frac{y^2}{b^2}-\frac{x^2}{a^2} = 1\end{aligned}$$ or
$$\frac{x^2}{a^2}-\frac{y^2}{b^2} = -1.$$ presents the [*conjugate
hyperbola*]{} of (1). Its transverse axis is the conjugate axis of (1)
and its conjugate axis the transverse axis of (1). Both hyperbolas are
conjugate hyperbolas of each other. They have the common asymptotes
$$\frac{x^2}{a^2}-\frac{y^2}{b^2} = 0$$ and their foci are on the circle
$x^2\!+\!y^2 = a^2\!+\!b^2$.
